text: [music playing]

JENNA WINGATE: She was
actually born at 29 pounds,
which is much, much lower.

The average hippo weight is
75 pounds when they're born.
And she wasn't able to stand.

She was too weak
to stand and nurse.

So after a few
hours, we realized

we were going to have to step in
if there was any chance for her
to survive.

The vets worked
around the clock.
And we had a nursery staff.

And it ended up being
about 25 people helping
to care for her 24 hours a day.

Now she's 350 pounds
and doing really well.
[music playing]

JENNA WINGATE: I think we
started calling each other
in emails "Team Fiona."

And then I think the hashtag
got added on from there.
[music playing]

JENNA WINGATE: Everyone got
to see her on a daily basis,

and see how she was
progressing, and even got to go
through the hard times with us.

Thanks to social media and
whatnot, the whole world
started following her.
She had this underdog story.

And honestly, we don't know of
any other premature hippo going
through this sort of situation.

And we are sharing
it with the world.
[music playing]
